meanings.definition: Having much knowledge acquired by study
meanings.sent1: She is a learned professor who teaches many subjects.
meanings.sent2: The book was written by a learned author with vast knowledge.
meanings.sent3: The learned cat surprised everyone by solving the puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her learned approach to problem-solving impressed her colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The learned scholar's wisdom was unmatched in the field.

meanings.sent1: His learned response to the question impressed the teacher.
meanings.sent2: The essay was well-written and showed a learned understanding of the topic.
meanings.sent3: The learned student's excitement was evident during the experiment.
meanings.sent4: Her learned expression indicated a deep understanding of the subject.
meanings.sent5: The learned presentation captivated the audience with its insights.

meanings.definition: Having knowledge or skill acquired by study or experience
meanings.sent1: The learned craftsman created beautiful pottery with skillful hands.
meanings.sent2: She shared her learned techniques with the new employees.
meanings.sent3: The learned chef surprised everyone with a new recipe.
meanings.sent4: His learned expertise in coding made him a valuable team member.
meanings.sent5: The learned musician's performance left the audience in awe.
